text: And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast [it] into the great winepress of the wrath of God.

label: John
text: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousand [and] six hundred furlongs.

label: John
text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is filled up the wrath of God.

label: John
text: And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over his mark, [and] over the number of his name, stand on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.

label: John
text: And they sing the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvellous [are] thy works, Lord God Almighty; just and true [are] thy ways, thou King of saints.

label: John
text: Who shall not fear thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name?

label: John
text: for [thou] only [art] holy: for all nations shall come and worship before thee; for thy judgments are made manifest.

label: John
text: And after that I looked, and, behold, the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened:

label: John
text: And the seven angels came out of the temple, having the seven plagues, clothed in pure and white linen, and having their breasts girded with golden girdles.

label: John
text: And one of the four beasts gave unto the seven angels seven golden vials full of the wrath of God, who liveth for ever and ever.

label: John
text: And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power; and no man was able to enter into the temple, till the seven plagues of the seven angels were fulfilled.

label: John
text: And I heard a great voice out of the temple saying to the seven angels, Go your ways, and pour out the vials of the wrath of God upon the earth.

label: John
text: And the first went, and poured out his vial upon the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore upon the men which had the mark of the beast, and [upon] them which worshipped his image.

label: John
text: And the second angel poured out his vial upon the sea; and it became as the blood of a dead [man]: and every living soul died in the sea.

label: John
text: And the third angel poured out his vial upon the rivers and fountains of waters; and they became blood.

label: John
text: And I heard the angel of the waters say, Thou art righteous, O Lord, which art, and wast, and shalt be, because thou hast judged thus.

label: John
text: For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthy.

label: John
text: And I heard another out of the altar say, Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous [are] thy judgments.

label: John
text: And the fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun; and power was given unto him to scorch men with fire.

label: John
text: And men were scorched with great heat, and blasphemed the name of God, which hath power over these plagues: and they repented not to give him glory.

label: John
text: And the fifth angel poured out his vial upon the seat of the beast; and his kingdom was full of darkness; and they gnawed their tongues for pain,

label: John
text: And blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, and repented not of their deeds.

label: John
text: And the sixth angel poured out his vial upon the great river Euphrates; and the water thereof was dried up, that the way of the kings of the east might be prepared.

label: John
text: And I saw three unclean spirits like frogs [come] out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

label: John
text: For they are the spirits of devils, working miracles, [which] go forth unto the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.

label: John
text: Behold, I come as a thief.

label: John
text: Blessed [is] he that watcheth, and keepeth his garments, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame.

label: John
text: And he gathered them together into a place called in the Hebrew tongue Armageddon.

label: John
text: And the seventh angel poured out his vial into the air; and there came a great voice out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, It is done.

label: John
text: And there were voices, and thunders, and lightnings; and there was a great earthquake, such as was not since men were upon the earth, so mighty an earthquake, [and] so great.

label: John
text: And the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell: and great Babylon came in remembrance before God, to give unto her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of his wrath.

label: John
text: And every island fled away, and the mountains were not found.

label: John
text: And there fell upon men a great hail out of heaven, [every stone] about the weight of a talent: and men blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail; for the plague thereof was exceeding great.

label: John
text: And there came one of the seven angels which had the seven vials, and talked with me, saying unto me, Come hither; I will shew unto thee the judgment of the great whore that sitteth upon many waters:

label: John
text: With whom the kings of the earth have committed fornication, and the inhabitants of the earth have been made drunk with the wine of her fornication.

label: John
text: So he carried me away in the spirit into the wilderness: and I saw a woman sit upon a scarlet coloured beast, full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.

label: John
text: And the woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet colour, and decked with gold and precious stones and pearls, having a golden cup in her hand full of abominations and filthiness of her fornication:

label: John
text: And upon her forehead [was] a name written, MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.

label: John
text: And I saw the woman drunken with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus: and when I saw her, I wondered with great admiration.

label: John
text: And the angel said unto me, Wherefore didst thou marvel?

label: John
text: I will tell thee the mystery of the woman, and of the beast that carrieth her, which hath the seven heads and ten horns.

label: John
text: The beast that thou sawest was, and is not; and shall ascend out of the bottomless pit, and go into perdition: and they that dwell on the earth shall wonder, whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, when they behold the beast that was, and is not, and yet is.

label: John
text: And here [is] the mind which hath wisdom.

label: John
text: The seven heads are seven mountains, on which the woman sitteth.

label: John
text: And there are seven kings: five are fallen, and one is, [and] the other is not yet come; and when he cometh, he must continue a short space.

label: John
text: And the beast that was, and is not, even he is the eighth, and is of the seven, and goeth into perdition.

label: John
text: And the ten horns which thou sawest are ten kings, which have received no kingdom as yet; but receive power as kings one hour with the beast.

label: John
text: These have one mind, and shall give their power and strength unto the beast.

label: John
text: These shall make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb shall overcome them: for he is Lord of lords, and King of kings: and they that are with him [are] called, and chosen, and faithful.

label: John
text: And he saith unto me, The waters which thou sawest, where the whore sitteth, are peoples, and multitudes, and nations, and tongues.

label: John
text: And the ten horns which thou sawest upon the beast, these shall hate the whore, and shall make her desolate and naked, and shall eat her flesh, and burn her with fire.

label: John
text: For God hath put in their hearts to fulfil his will, and to agree, and give their kingdom unto the beast, until the words of God shall be fulfilled.

label: John
text: And the woman which thou sawest is that great city, which reigneth over the kings of the earth.

label: John
text: And after these things I saw another angel come down from heaven, having great power; and the earth was lightened with his glory.

label: John
text: And he cried mightily with a strong voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils, and the hold of every foul spirit, and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird.

label: John
text: For all nations have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her fornication, and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the merchants of the earth are waxed rich through the abundance of her delicacies.

label: John
text: And I heard another voice from heaven, saying, Come out of her, my people, that ye be not partakers of her sins, and that ye receive not of her plagues.

label: John
text: For her sins have reached unto heaven, and God hath remembered her iniquities.

label: John
text: Reward her even as she rewarded you, and double unto her double according to her works: in the cup which she hath filled fill to her double.

label: John
text: How much she hath glorified herself, and lived deliciously, so much torment and sorrow give her: for she saith in her heart, I sit a queen, and am no widow, and shall see no sorrow.

label: John
text: Therefore shall her plagues come in one day, death, and mourning, and famine; and she shall be utterly burned with fire: for strong [is] the Lord God who judgeth her.

label: John
text: And the kings of the earth, who have committed fornication and lived deliciously with her, shall bewail her, and lament for her, when they shall see the smoke of her burning,

label: John
text: Standing afar off for the fear of her torment, saying, Alas, alas, that great city Babylon, that mighty city!

label: John
text: for in one hour is thy judgment come.

label: John
text: And the merchants of the earth shall weep and mourn over her; for no man buyeth their merchandise any more:

label: John
text: The merchandise of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and of pearls, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet, and all thyine wood, and all manner vessels of ivory, and all manner vessels of most precious wood, and of brass, and iron, and marble,

label: John
text: And cinnamon, and odours, and ointments, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat, and beasts, and sheep, and horses, and chariots, and slaves, and souls of men.

label: John

text: But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.

label: Paul
text: For every man shall bear his own burden.

label: Paul
text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.

label: Paul
text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

label: Paul
text: For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.

label: Paul
text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

label: Paul
text: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all [men], especially unto them who are of the household of faith.

label: Paul
text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.

label: Paul
text: As many as desire to make a fair shew in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.

label: Paul
text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law; but desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.

label: Paul
text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.

label: Paul
text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.

label: Paul
text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace [be] on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

label: Paul
text: From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:

label: Paul
text: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

label: Paul
text: Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,

label: Paul
text: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;

label: Paul
text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform [it] until the day of Jesus Christ:

label: Paul
text: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.

label: Paul
text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and [in] all judgment;

label: Paul
text: That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;

label: Paul
text: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

label: Paul
text: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things [which happened] unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;

label: Paul
text: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other [places];

label: Paul
text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

label: Paul
text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:

label: Paul
text: The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:

label: Paul
text: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.

label: Paul
text: What then?

label: Paul
text: notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

label: Paul
text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

label: Paul
text: According to my earnest expectation and [my] hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but [that] with all boldness, as always, [so] now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether [it be] by life, or by death.

label: Paul
text: For to me to live [is] Christ, and to die [is] gain.

label: Paul
text: But if I live in the flesh, this [is] the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.

label: Paul
text: For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh [is] more needful for you.

label: Paul
text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

label: Paul
text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

label: Paul
text: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;

label: Paul
text: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.

label: Paul
text: For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;

label: Paul
text: Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear [to be] in me.

label: Paul
text: If [there be] therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,

label: Paul
text: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, [being] of one accord, of one mind.

label: Paul
text: [Let] nothing [be done] through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

label: Paul
text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

label: Paul
text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

label: Paul
text: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

label: Paul
text: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

label: Paul
text: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

label: Paul
text: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of [things] in heaven, and [things] in earth, and [things] under the earth;

label: Paul
text: And [that] every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ [is] Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

label: Paul
text: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of [his] good pleasure.

label: Paul
text: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

label: Paul
text: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

label: Paul
text: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

label: Paul
text: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

label: Paul
text: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

label: Paul
text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

label: Paul
text: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.

label: Paul
text: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.

label: Paul
text: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.

label: Paul
text: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

label: Paul
text: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

label: Paul
text: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.

label: Paul
text: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.

label: Paul
text: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.

label: Paul
text: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

label: Paul
text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

label: Paul
text: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.

label: Paul
text: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: To write the same things to you, to me indeed [is] not grievous, but for you [it is] safe.

label: Paul
text: Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the concision.

label: Paul
text: For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.

label: Paul
text: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh.

label: Paul
text: If any other man thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh, I more:

label: Paul
text: Circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, [of] the tribe of Benjamin, an Hebrew of the Hebrews; as touching the law, a Pharisee;

label: Paul
text: Concerning zeal, persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.

label: Paul
text: But what things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ.

label: Paul
text: Yea doubtless, and I count all things [but] loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them [but] dung, that I may win Christ,

label: Paul
text: And be found in him, not having mine own righteousness, which is of the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is of God by faith:

label: Paul
text: That I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being made conformable unto his death;

label: Paul
text: If by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.

label: Paul
text: Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but [this] one thing [I do], forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,

label: Paul
text: I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Let us therefore, as many as be perfect, be thus minded: and if in any thing ye be otherwise minded, God shall reveal even this unto you.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless, whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.

label: Paul
text: (For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, [that they are] the enemies of the cross of Christ:

label: Paul
text: Whose end [is] destruction, whose God [is their] belly, and [whose] glory [is] in their shame, who mind earthly things.)

label: Paul
text: For our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:

label: Paul
text: Who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself.

label: Paul
text: Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, [my] dearly beloved.

label: Paul
text: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and [with] other my fellowlabourers, whose names [are] in the book of life.

label: Paul
text: Rejoice in the Lord alway: [and] again I say, Rejoice.

label: Paul
text: Let your moderation be known unto all men.

label: Paul
text: The Lord [is] at hand.

label: Paul
text: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

label: Paul
text: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things [are] honest, whatsoever things [are] just, whatsoever things [are] pure, whatsoever things [are] lovely, whatsoever things [are] of good report; if [there be] any virtue, and if [there be] any praise, think on these things.

label: Paul
text: Those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, do: and the God of peace shall be with you.

label: Paul
text: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care of me hath flourished again; wherein ye were also careful, but ye lacked opportunity.

label: Paul
text: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, [therewith] to be content.

label: Paul
text: I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: every where and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.

label: Paul
text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

label: Paul
text: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate with my affliction.

label: Paul
text: Now ye Philippians know also, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only.

label: Paul
text: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.

label: Paul
text: Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.

label: Paul
text: But I have all, and abound: I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things [which were sent] from you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.

label: Paul
text: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Now unto God and our Father [be] glory for ever and ever.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: The brethren which are with me greet you.

label: Paul
text: All the saints salute you, chiefly they that are of Caesar’s household.

label: Paul
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians [which is] in God the Father and [in] the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;

label: Paul
text: Remembering without ceasing your work of faith, and labour of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, in the sight of God and our Father;

label: Paul
text: Knowing, brethren beloved, your election of God.

label: Paul
text: For our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Ghost, and in much assurance; as ye know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.

label: Paul
text: And ye became followers of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Ghost:

label: Paul
text: So that ye were ensamples to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.

label: Paul
text: For from you sounded out the word of the Lord not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith to God-ward is spread abroad; so that we need not to speak any thing.

label: Paul
text: For they themselves shew of us what manner of entering in we had unto you, and how ye turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God;

label: Paul
text: And to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, [even] Jesus, which delivered us from the wrath to come.

label: Paul
text: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

label: Paul
text: But even after that we had suffered before, and were shamefully entreated, as ye know, at Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God with much contention.

label: Paul
text: For our exhortation [was] not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:

label: Paul
text: But as we were allowed of God to be put in trust with the gospel, even so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, which trieth our hearts.

label: Paul
text: For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; God [is] witness:

label: Paul
text: Nor of men sought we glory, neither of you, nor [yet] of others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.

label: Paul
text: But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:

label: Paul
text: So being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

label: Paul
text: For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.

label: Paul
text: Ye [are] witnesses, and God [also], how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:

label: Paul
text: As ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a father [doth] his children,

label: Paul
text: That ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

label: Paul
text: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye received [it] not [as] the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.

label: Paul
text: For ye, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judaea are in Christ Jesus: for ye also have suffered like things of your own countrymen, even as they [have] of the Jews:

label: Paul
text: Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:

label: Paul
text: Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

label: Paul
text: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.

label: Paul
text: For what [is] our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing?

label: Paul
text: [Are] not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?

label: Paul
text: For ye are our glory and joy.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left at Athens alone;

label: Paul
text: And sent Timotheus, our brother, and minister of God, and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith:

label: Paul
text: That no man should be moved by these afflictions: for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto.

label: Paul
text: For verily, when we were with you, we told you before that we should suffer tribulation; even as it came to pass, and ye know.

label: Paul
text: For this cause, when I could no longer forbear, I sent to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter have tempted you, and our labour be in vain.

label: Paul
text: But now when Timotheus came from you unto us, and brought us good tidings of your faith and charity, and that ye have good remembrance of us always, desiring greatly to see us, as we also [to see] you:

label: Paul
text: Therefore, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith:

label: Paul
text: For now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: For what thanks can we render to God again for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;

label: Paul
text: Night and day praying exceedingly that we might see your face, and might perfect that which is lacking in your faith?

label: Paul
text: Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.

label: Paul
text: And the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all [men], even as we [do] toward you:

label: Paul
text: To the end he may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all his saints.

label: Paul
text: Furthermore then we beseech you, brethren, and exhort [you] by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, [so] ye would abound more and more.

label: Paul
text: For ye know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus.

label: Paul
text: For this is the will of God, [even] your sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication:

label: Paul
text: That every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour;

label: Paul
text: Not in the lust of concupiscence, even as the Gentiles which know not God:

label: Paul
text: That no [man] go beyond and defraud his brother in [any] matter: because that the Lord [is] the avenger of all such, as we also have forewarned you and testified.

label: Paul
text: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.

label: Paul
text: He therefore that despiseth, despiseth not man, but God, who hath also given unto us his holy Spirit.

label: Paul
text: But as touching brotherly love ye need not that I write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another.

label: Paul
text: And indeed ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all Macedonia: but we beseech you, brethren, that ye increase more and more;

label: Paul
text: And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you;

label: Paul
text: That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and [that] ye may have lack of nothing.

label: Paul
text: But I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as others which have no hope.

label: Paul
text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him.

label: Paul
text: For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we which are alive [and] remain unto the coming of the Lord shall not prevent them which are asleep.

label: Paul
text: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

label: Paul
text: Then we which are alive [and] remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

label: Paul
text: But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you.

label: Paul
text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.

label: Paul
text: For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape.

label: Paul
text: But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

label: Paul
text: Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness.

label: Paul
text: Therefore let us not sleep, as [do] others; but let us watch and be sober.

label: Paul
text: For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

label: Paul
text: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation.

label: Paul
text: For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

label: Paul
text: Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

label: Paul
text: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you;

label: Paul
text: And to esteem them very highly in love for their work’s sake.

label: Paul
text: [And] be at peace among yourselves.

label: Paul
text: Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all [men].

label: Paul
text: See that none render evil for evil unto any [man]; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all [men].

label: Paul
text: Rejoice evermore.

label: Paul
text: Pray without ceasing.

label: Paul
text: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

label: Paul
text: Quench not the Spirit.

label: Paul
text: Despise not prophesyings.

label: Paul
text: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

label: Paul
text: Abstain from all appearance of evil.

label: Paul
text: And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and [I pray God] your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: Faithful [is] he that calleth you, who also will do [it].

label: Paul
text: Brethren, pray for us.

label: Paul
text: Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.

label: Paul
text: I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.

label: Paul
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy [our] brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

label: Paul
text: And to [our] beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

label: Paul
text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

label: Paul
text: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

label: Paul
text: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

label: Paul
text: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech [thee], being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

label: Paul
text: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

label: Paul
text: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

label: Paul
text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

label: Paul
text: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

label: Paul
text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

label: Paul
text: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

label: Paul
text: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

label: Paul
text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth [thee] ought, put that on mine account;

label: Paul
text: I Paul have written [it] with mine own hand, I will repay [it]: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

label: Paul
text: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

label: Paul
text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

label: Paul
text: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

label: Paul
text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

label: Paul
text: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

label: Paul
text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Peter
text: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy [are ye]; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

label: Peter
text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, or [as] a thief, or [as] an evildoer, or as a busybody in other men’s matters.

label: Peter
text: Yet if [any man suffer] as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf.

label: Peter
text: For the time [is come] that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if [it] first [begin] at us, what shall the end [be] of them that obey not the gospel of God?

label: Peter
text: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

label: Peter
text: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls [to him] in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

label: Peter
text: The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

label: Peter
text: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight [thereof], not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

label: Peter
text: Neither as being lords over [God’s] heritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

label: Peter
text: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

label: Peter
text: Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder.

label: Peter
text: Yea, all [of you] be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

label: Peter
text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:

label: Peter
text: Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.

label: Peter
text: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

label: Peter
text: Whom resist stedfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren that are in the world.

label: Peter
text: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle [you].

label: Peter
text: To him [be] glory and dominion for ever and ever.

label: Peter
text: Amen.

label: Peter
text: By Silvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I suppose, I have written briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein ye stand.

label: Peter
text: The [church that is] at Babylon, elected together with [you], saluteth you; and [so doth] Marcus my son.

label: Peter
text: Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity.

label: Peter
text: Peace [be] with you all that are in Christ Jesus.

label: Peter
text: Amen.

label: James
text: Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.

label: James
text: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire.

label: James
text: Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.

label: James
text: Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

label: James
text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

label: James
text: Ye have condemned [and] killed the just; [and] he doth not resist you.

label: James
text: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord.

label: James
text: Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

label: James
text: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

label: James
text: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

label: James
text: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

label: James
text: Behold, we count them happy which endure.

label: James
text: Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.

label: James
text: But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and [your] nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.

label: James
text: Is any among you afflicted?

label: James
text: let him pray.

label: James
text: Is any merry?

label: James
text: let him sing psalms.

label: James
text: Is any sick among you?

label: James
text: let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:

label: James
text: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.

label: James
text: Confess [your] faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed.

label: James
text: The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

label: James
text: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.

label: James
text: And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.

label: James
text: Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;

label: James
text: Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.

label: Jude
text: Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.

label: Jude
text: And of some have compassion, making a difference:

label: Jude
text: And others save with fear, pulling [them] out of the fire; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh.

label: Jude
text: Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present [you] faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy,

label: Jude
text: To the only wise God our Saviour, [be] glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and ever.

label: Jude
text: Amen.
